tool.name: Read TCGA Illumina 450k IDAT

configfiles.configfile:
## Setup R error handling to go to stderr options(show.error.messages=F,error = function (){cat(geterrmessage(), file=stderr());q("no",1,F)})
## code chunk: Load all required libraries quietly library('minfi', quietly=TRUE, warn.conflicts=FALSE,verbose = FALSE)
## Read the TCGA data dat = readTCGA("${input}", sep = "\t", keyName = "Composite Element REF", Betaname = "Beta_value", pData = NULL, array = "IlluminaHumanMethylation450k",showProgress=FALSE)
## Get beta values beta = getBeta(dat)
## Save RGset for TCGA data save(dat,file="GenomicRatioSet.Rdata")
## Store beta values in a table write.table(beta, file = "${output}" ,row.names = F,quote = F, sep="\t")

tool.help:
**What it does** This tool returns a matrix of "beta values" from Illumina 450k Methylation data, from TCGA.
**Input**:
Currently, an example of a file that this function reads is here:
http://gdac.broadinstitute.org/runs/stddata__2014_10_17/data/UCEC/20141017/gdac.broadinstitute.org_UCEC.Merge_methylation__humanmethylation450__jhu_usc_edu__Level_3__within_bioassay_data_set_function__data.Level_3.2014101700.0.0.tar.gz
1. Upload the file into galaxy.
2. Run the "Get TCGA 450k data" tool on the resultant tar file in your history.
3. Once you have the "Probe and sample wise data" generated, Run "Read TCGA 450k matrix" to generate beta values.
**Output**:
Beta values in tabular/matrix format which can be used in multiple tools like ELMER, minfi, bumphunter
